meanings.definition: Willingness to consider new ideas or suggestions.
meanings.sent1: Her receptiveness to different opinions made her a great team player.
meanings.sent2: The manager valued the employee's receptiveness to feedback.
meanings.sent3: The receptiveness of the robot to commands was impressive.
meanings.sent4: His receptiveness to change was like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The receptiveness of the soil to nutrients determined the plant's growth.

meanings.definition: Ability to receive or accept something.
meanings.sent1: The receptiveness of the device to signals was crucial for its function.
meanings.sent2: The receptiveness of the audience to the speaker's message was evident.
meanings.sent3: The receptiveness of the mailbox to letters always amazed the little girl.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had a receptiveness to love that knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The receptiveness of the skin to moisturizer kept it soft and supple.
